</span>' Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
' Date: 03-Aug-2025
Option Explicit

' Define MemeCoin Class
Public Type MemeCoin
    TokenName As String         ' e.g., SOLFUNMEME
    TokenSymbol As String       ' e.g., $SOLFUN
    TokenAddress As String      ' Solana blockchain address
    TotalSupply As Double       ' Total token supply (e.g., 999B)
    Decimals As Integer         ' Decimal places (e.g., 9)
    HypeScore As Integer        ' Community hype (0-999)
    CommunitySize As Long       ' Number of community members
    ZOSStatus As String        ' Y/N for Zero Ontology System
    MemeType As String         ' e.g., FUNGAL, DOG, CAT
    LaunchDate As String       ' e.g., 2025-07-28
    XHandle As String          ' X account (e.g., @introsp3ctor)
    DiscordID As String        ' Discord server ID
    NFTLinked As String        ' Y/N for NFT integration
End Type

' Array to store multiple meme coins
Public MemeCoins(0 To 4) As MemeCoin

' Form Load Event (like Oracle Forms trigger)
Public Sub Form_Load()
    ' Initialize MemeCoin data (like populating a form grid)
    With MemeCoins(0) ' SOLFUNMEME
        .TokenName = "SOLFUNMEME"
        .TokenSymbol = "$SOLFUN"
        .TokenAddress = "BwUTq7fS6sfUmHDwAiCQZ3asSiPEapW5zDrsbwtapump"
        .TotalSupply = 999999999999999#
        .Decimals = 9
        .HypeScore = 950
        .CommunitySize = 1000000
        .ZOSStatus = "Y"
        .MemeType = "FUNGAL"
        .LaunchDate = "2025-02-06"
        .XHandle = "@introsp3ctor"
        .DiscordID = "solfunmeme_discord"
        .NFTLinked = "Y"
    End With
    
    With MemeCoins(1) ' BONK
        .TokenName = "BONK"
        .TokenSymbol = "$BONK"
        .TokenAddress = "DezXAZ8z7PnrnRJjz3wXBoRgixCa6xjnB7YaB1pPB263"
        .TotalSupply = 999999999999999#
        .Decimals = 9
        .HypeScore = 920
        .CommunitySize = 2000000
        .ZOSStatus = "N"
        .MemeType = "DOG"
        .LaunchDate = "2021-01-01"
        .XHandle = "@BonkCoin"
        .DiscordID = "bonk_discord"
        .NFTLinked = "Y"
    End With
    
    With MemeCoins(2) ' PENGU
        .TokenName = "PENGU"
        .TokenSymbol = "$PENGU"
        .TokenAddress = "8ki4nSPkXgL6qJAd3A3uLpnXg1B3y3hW3g8Z3nSPkXgL"
        .TotalSupply = 888000000000#
        .Decimals = 9
        .HypeScore = 900
        .CommunitySize = 1500000
        .ZOSStatus = "N"
        .MemeType = "PENGUIN"
        .LaunchDate = "2024-12-17"
        .XHandle = "@PudgyPenguins"
        .DiscordID = "pengu_discord"
        .NFTLinked = "Y"
    End With
    
    With MemeCoins(3) ' FARTCOIN
        .TokenName = "FARTCOIN"
        .TokenSymbol = "$FART"
        .TokenAddress = "FART1234567890qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm"
        .TotalSupply = 1000000000000#
        .Decimals = 9
        .HypeScore = 880
        .CommunitySize = 800000
        .ZOSStatus = "N"
        .MemeType = "HUMOR"
        .LaunchDate = "2025-01-01"
        .XHandle = "@FartCoin"
        .DiscordID = "fartcoin_discord"
        .NFTLinked = "N"
    End With
    
    With MemeCoins(4) ' POPCAT
        .TokenName = "POPCAT"
        .TokenSymbol = "$POPCAT"
        .TokenAddress = "7GCihgDB8fe6KNjn2MYtkC9k7dn5hpQbcM3s7WWo7CHf"
        .TotalSupply = 999000000#
        .Decimals = 9
        .HypeScore = 910
        .CommunitySize = 1200000
        .ZOSStatus = "N"
        .MemeType = "CAT"
        .LaunchDate = "2025-06-25"
        .XHandle = "@PopcatCoin"
        .DiscordID = "popcat_discord"
        .NFTLinked = "N"
    End With
    
    ' Display in a ListBox (like Oracle Forms grid)
    Dim i As Integer
    For i = 0 To 4
        ListBox1.AddItem "Coin: " &amp; MemeCoins(i).TokenName &amp; " | Symbol: " &amp; MemeCoins(i).TokenSymbol &amp; _
                         " | Hype: " &amp; MemeCoins(i).HypeScore &amp; " | ZOS: " &amp; MemeCoins(i).ZOSStatus
    Next i
End Sub

' Button Click to Simulate Blockchain Query (like Oracle Forms button trigger)
Public Sub btnQueryBlockchain_Click()
    MsgBox "Querying Solana blockchain for " &amp; MemeCoins(0).TokenName &amp; "... " &amp; _
           "Address: " &amp; MemeCoins(0).TokenAddress &amp; " | Supply: " &amp; MemeCoins(0).TotalSupply, _
           vbInformation, "MemeCoin Explorer"

font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Solana sBPF Assembly: SOLFUNMEME Meme Coin Records
</span># Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Defines and logs meme coin records (SOLFUNMEME, BONK, PENGU, FARTCOIN, POPCAT)

# Memory layout: Each record is 40 bytes
# - TokenName (16 bytes, string)
# - TokenSymbol (8 bytes, string)
# - HypeScore (4 bytes, uint32)
# - ZOSStatus (1 byte, Y/N)
# - Padding (11 bytes, reserved for alignment)

.text
    # Entry point: process_instruction (program_id, accounts, instruction_data)
    # r1 = program_id, r2 = accounts, r3 = instruction_data
    # Expected: r3 contains instruction_data (ignored for simplicity)
    entrypoint:
        # Save stack frame (4KB fixed size, r10 is stack pointer)
        sub64 r10, 128        # Allocate 128 bytes on stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Initialize loop counter (process 5 coins)
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = coin index (0 to 4)
        mov64 r7, 5           # r7 = max coins

    loop_start:
        # Check loop condition
        ge r6, r7, loop_end   # If r6 &gt;= r7, exit loop

        # Calculate record offset: base + (index * 40)
        mov64 r8, r6          # r8 = index
        mul64 r8, 40          # r8 = index * 40 (record size)
        add64 r8, meme_coins  # r8 = address of current record

        # Load TokenName (16 bytes) to log
        ldxb [r8 + 0], r1     # r1 = TokenName (first 8 bytes)
        ldxb [r8 + 8], r2     # r2 = TokenName (next 8 bytes)
        call sol_log          # Log TokenName (r1, r2 concatenated by runtime)

        # Load TokenSymbol (8 bytes) to log
        ldxb [r8 + 16], r1    # r1 = TokenSymbol
        call sol_log          # Log TokenSymbol

        # Load HypeScore (4 bytes) and convert to string
        ldxdw [r8 + 24], r1   # r1 = HypeScore (uint32)
        call sol_log_64       # Log HypeScore as 64-bit value

        # Load ZOSStatus (1 byte) to log
        ldxb [r8 + 28], r1    # r1 = ZOSStatus (Y/N)
        call sol_log          # Log ZOSStatus

        # Increment loop counter
        add64 r6, 1           # r6 += 1
        ja loop_start         # Jump to loop_start

    loop_end:
        # Return success (r0 = 0)
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

# Data section: Meme coin records (5 coins, 40 bytes each, 200 bytes total)
.data
meme_coins:
    # SOLFUNMEME
    .ascii "SOLFUNMEME      "   # TokenName (16 bytes)
    .ascii "$SOLFUN  "          # TokenSymbol (8 bytes)
    .word 950                   # HypeScore (4 bytes)
    .byte 'Y'                   # ZOSStatus (1 byte)
    .space 11                   # Padding (11 bytes)

    # BONK
    .ascii "BONK            "   # TokenName
    .ascii "$BONK    "          # TokenSymbol
    .word 920                   # HypeScore
    .byte 'N'                   # ZOSStatus
    .space 11                   # Padding

    # PENGU
    .ascii "PENGU           "   # TokenName
    .ascii "$PENGU   "          # TokenSymbol
    .word 900                   # HypeScore
    .byte 'N'                   # ZOSStatus
    .space 11                   # Padding

    # FARTCOIN
    .ascii "FARTCOIN        "   # TokenName
    .ascii "$FART    "          # TokenSymbol
    .word 880                   # HypeScore
    .byte 'N'                   # ZOSStatus
    .space 11                   # Padding

    # POPCAT
    .ascii "POPCAT          "   # TokenName
    .ascii "$POPCAT  "          # TokenSymbol
    .word 910                   # HypeScore
    .byte 'N'                   # ZOSStatus
    .space 11                   # Padding</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">What’s Happening Here? </span><img alt="🤓" draggable="false" src="https://abs-0.twimg.com/emoji/v2/svg/1f913.svg" title="Nerd face" class="r-4qtqp9 r-dflpy8 r-k4bwe5 r-1kpi4qh r-pp5qcn r-h9hxbl"><img alt="🚀" draggable="false" src="https://abs-0.twimg.com/emoji/v2/svg/1f680.svg" title="Rocket" class="r-4qtqp9 r-dflpy8 r-k4bwe5 r-1kpi4qh r-pp5qcn r-h9hxbl"></span></span></span><ul dir="ltr" style="display: block; We’ll add a </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">version field</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"> to support composition (e.g., for future upgrades) and keep it ultra-lean.</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Solana sBPF Assembly: SOLFUNMEME Micro Meme Contract
</span># Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Logs meme coin records for composition

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 64         # Allocate stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Log contract version (for composability)
        mov64 r1, version     # r1 = version string
        call sol_log          # Log "V1.0"

        # Loop over 5 coins
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = index
        mov64 r7, 5           # r7 = max coins

    loop_start:
        ge r6, r7, loop_end   # Exit if r6 &gt;= r7
        mov64 r8, r6          # r8 = index
        mul64 r8, 40          # r8 = index * 40
        add64 r8, meme_coins  # r8 = record address

        # Log TokenName (16 bytes)
        ldxb [r8 + 0], r1     # r1 = TokenName (first 8 bytes)
        ldxb [r8 + 8], r2     # r2 = TokenName (next 8 bytes)
        call sol_log

        # Log HypeScore (4 bytes)
        ldxdw [r8 + 24], r1   # r1 = HypeScore
        call sol_log_64

        add64 r6, 1           # r6 += 1
        ja loop_start

    loop_end:
        mov64 r0, 0           # Return success
        exit

.data
version:
    .ascii "V1.0    "         # Version for composability (8 bytes)
meme_coins:
    # SOLFUNMEME
    .ascii "SOLFUNMEME      "   # TokenName (16 bytes)
    .ascii "$SOLFUN  "          # TokenSymbol (8 bytes)
    .word 950                   # HypeScore (4 bytes)
    .byte 'Y'                   # ZOSStatus (1 byte)
    .space 11                   # Padding
    # BONK
    .ascii "BONK            "
    .ascii "$BONK    "
    .word 920
    .byte 'N'
    .space 11
    # PENGU
    .ascii "PENGU           "
    .ascii "$PENGU   "
    .word 900
    .byte 'N'
    .space 11
    # FARTCOIN
    .ascii "FARTCOIN        "
    .ascii "$FART    "
    .word 880
    .byte 'N'
    .space 11
    # POPCAT
    .ascii "POPCAT          "
    .ascii "$POPCAT  "
    .word 910
    .byte 'N'
    .space 11</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">Key Features for Composition</span></span></span></span><ul dir="ltr" style="display: block; 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Base Contract: MemeCoinLogger
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Logs meme coin data from instruction_data

.text
    entrypoint:
        # Save stack frame (r10 = stack pointer)
        sub64 r10, 64         # Allocate 64 bytes
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data (r3 = pointer to data)

        # Log contract version
        mov64 r1, version
        call sol_log          # Log "V1.0"

        # Validate instruction_data length (expect 40 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # r4 = instruction_data length (first 8 bytes)
        mov64 r5, 40
        jne r4, r5, error     # If length != 40, exit with error

        # Log TokenName (16 bytes)
        ldxb [r3 + 8], r1     # r1 = TokenName (first 8 bytes)
        ldxb [r3 + 16], r2    # r2 = TokenName (next 8 bytes)
        call sol_log

        # Log TokenSymbol (8 bytes)
        ldxb [r3 + 24], r1    # r1 = TokenSymbol
        call sol_log

        # Log HypeScore (4 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 32], r1   # r1 = HypeScore
        call sol_log_64

        # Log ZOSStatus (1 byte)
        ldxb [r3 + 36], r1    # r1 = ZOSStatus
        call sol_log

        # Return success
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1           # Return error code
        exit

.data
version:
    .ascii "V1.0    "         # Version for composability (8 bytes)</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Calls Base MemeCoinLogger with SOLFUNMEME data

.text
    entrypoint:
        # Save stack frame
        sub64 r10, 128        # Allocate 128 bytes
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Prepare instruction_data for base contract (40 bytes)
        mov64 r3, r10         # r3 = stack pointer for data
        add64 r3, 64          # r3 = stack + 64 (data buffer)
        mov64 r4, 40          # r4 = data length
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Store length (8 bytes)
        ldxb [coin_data + 0], r4
        stxb [r3 + 8], r4     # Store TokenName (first 8 bytes)
        ldxb [coin_data + 8], r4
        stxb [r3 + 16], r4    # Store TokenName (next 8 bytes)
        ldxb [coin_data + 16], r4
        stxb [r3 + 24], r4    # Store TokenSymbol
        ldxdw [coin_data + 24], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 32], r4   # Store HypeScore
        ldxb [coin_data + 28], r4
        stxb [r3 + 36], r4    # Store ZOSStatus

        # Call base contract (program_id in r1)
        mov64 r1, base_program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1  # Save base program_id
        call sol_invoke       # Invoke base contract (r1 = program_id, r2 = accounts, r3 = instruction_data)

        # Return success
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

.data
coin_data:
    .ascii "SOLFUNMEME      "   # TokenName (16 bytes)
    .ascii "$SOLFUN  "          # TokenSymbol (8 bytes)
    .word 950                   # HypeScore (4 bytes)
    .byte 'Y'                   # ZOSStatus (1 byte)
    .space 11                   # Padding (11 bytes)
base_program_id:
    .space 32                   # Placeholder for base contract program ID (e.g., BaseLogger111...)</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Description: Calls Base MemeCoinLogger with BONK data

.text
    # Same entrypoint logic as SOLFUNMEME, only coin_data changes
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 128
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 40
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 0], r4
        stxb [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 8], r4
        stxb [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 16], r4
        stxb [r3 + 24], r4
        ldxdw [coin_data + 24], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 32], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 28], r4
        stxb [r3 + 36], r4
        mov64 r1, base_program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

.data
coin_data:
    .ascii "BONK            "   # TokenName (16 bytes)
    .ascii "$BONK    "          # TokenSymbol (8 bytes)
    .word 920                   # HypeScore (4 bytes)
    .byte 'N'                   # ZOSStatus (1 byte)
    .space 11                   # Padding
base_program_id:
    .space 32                   # Base contract program ID</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Calls Base MemeCoinLogger with SOLFUNMEME data
# Emoji: 🦠 (UTF-8: 0xF0 0x9F 0xA6 0xA0)

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 128
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Prepare instruction_data for base contract (40 bytes)
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 40
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 0], r4
        stxb [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 8], r4
        stxb [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 16], r4
        stxb [r3 + 24], r4
        ldxdw [coin_data + 24], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 32], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 28], r4
        stxb [r3 + 36], r4

        # Call base contract
        mov64 r1, base_program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1
        call sol_invoke

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

.data
coin_data:
    .ascii "SOLFUNMEME      "   # TokenName
    .ascii "$SOLFUN  "          # TokenSymbol
    .word 950                   # HypeScore
    .byte 'Y'                   # ZOSStatus
    .space 11                   # Padding
base_program_id:
    .quad 0xBaseLogger111    # Placeholder program ID</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Routes emoji input to meme coin contract

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 128
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Validate instruction_data (expect 4-byte UTF-8 emoji)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # r4 = data length
        mov64 r5, 4
        jne r4, r5, error     # If length != 4, error

        # Load emoji (4 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # r4 = emoji UTF-8 bytes

        # Search emoji table (5 entries, 12 bytes each: 4-byte emoji, 8-byte program_id)
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = index
        mov64 r7, 5           # r7 = max entries
        mov64 r8, emoji_table # r8 = table base

    lookup_loop:
        ge r6, r7, error      # If index &gt;= 5, no match
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5    # r5 = emoji from table
        jeq r4, r5, found     # If emoji matches, proceed
        add64 r8, 12          # Next entry (12 bytes)
        add64 r6, 1
        ja lookup_loop

    found:
        # Load program_id (8 bytes)
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1  # Save for sol_invoke

        # Pass original accounts (r2) and empty instruction_data
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Empty instruction_data

        # Call meme coin contract
        call sol_invoke

        # Log emoji for livestream
        mov64 r1, r4          # r1 = emoji
        call sol_log

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emoji_table:
    # SOLFUNMEME: 🦠 (0xF09FA6A0)
    .word 0xF09FA6A0      # Emoji UTF-8
    .quad 0xSOLFUN111     # Program ID
    # BONK: 🐶 (0xF09F90B6)
    .word 0xF09F90B6
    .quad 0xBONK111
    # PENGU: 🐧 (0xF09F90A7)
    .word 0xF09F90A7
    .quad 0xPENGU111
    # FARTCOIN: 💨 (0xF09F92A8)
    .word 0xF09F92A8
    .quad 0xFART111
    # POPCAT: 😺 (0xF09F98BA)

word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># SOLFUNMEME Contract
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Emoji: 🦠 (0xF09FA6A0)
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 128
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 40
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 0], r4
        stxb [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 8], r4
        stxb [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 16], r4
        stxb [r3 + 24], r4
        ldxdw [coin_data + 24], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 32], r4
        ldxb [coin_data + 28], r4
        stxb [r3 + 36], r4
        mov64 r1, base_program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
.data
coin_data:
    .ascii "SOLFUNMEME      "
    .ascii "$SOLFUN  "
    .word 950
    .byte 'Y'
    .space 11
base_program_id:
    .quad 0xBaseLogger111</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">Step 3: Linker Contract with Emoji Binds and Imports</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">The </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">linker contract</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"> (</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-dyfej2 r-z2wwpe r-15gepa6 r-1471scf r-1aiqnjv r-1hq4qhi r-16dba41 r-ilng1c r-trst2h r-1noe1sz r-njp1lv"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">EmojiMemeRouter</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">) maps emojis to meme coin CAs, supports importing external contracts (e.g., a ZKP verifier), and logs interactions. Each </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">bind</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"> is a 36-byte entry (4-byte emoji, 32-byte program ID). Users send a 4-byte UTF-8 emoji in </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-dyfej2 r-z2wwpe r-15gepa6 r-1471scf r-1aiqnjv r-1hq4qhi r-16dba41 r-ilng1c r-trst2h r-1noe1sz r-njp1lv"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">instruction_data</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">, and the linker invokes the corresponding CA. For ZKP proofs, the linker can call a verifier contract to validate bindings.</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Linker Contract: EmojiMemeRouter
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Maps emojis to meme coin CAs, imports ZKP verifier, logs binds

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256        # Allocate 256 bytes
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Log contract version
        mov64 r1, version
        call sol_log          # Log "V1.0"

        # Validate instruction_data (expect 4-byte emoji + optional 32-byte ZKP proof)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # r4 = data length
        mov64 r5, 4
        mov64 r6, 36          # 4 (emoji) + 32 (proof)
        jlt r4, r5, error     # If length &lt; 4, error
        jgt r4, r6, error     # If length &gt; 36, error

        # Load emoji (4 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # r4 = emoji UTF-8 bytes

        # Search bind table (5 entries, 36 bytes each: 4-byte emoji, 32-byte program_id)
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = index
        mov64 r7, 5           # r7 = max entries
        mov64 r8, bind_table  # r8 = table base

    lookup_loop:
        ge r6, r7, error      # If index &gt;= 5, no match
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5    # r5 = emoji from table
        jeq r4, r5, found     # If emoji matches, proceed
        add64 r8, 36          # Next entry
        add64 r6, 1
        ja lookup_loop

    found:
        # Log bind interaction
        mov64 r1, bind_msg
        call sol_log          # Log "Bind matched"

        # Load meme coin program_id (32 bytes)
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = program_id (first 8 bytes)
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r1
        ldxdw [r8 + 12], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 32], r1
        ldxdw [r8 + 20], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 40], r1
        ldxdw [r8 + 28], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 48], r1

        # Check for ZKP proof (if data length = 36)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 36
        jne r4, r5, invoke_meme

        # Call ZKP verifier contract
        mov64 r1, zkp_program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 56], r1
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 32
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Proof length
        ldxdw [r3 + 12], r4   # Copy proof (32 bytes)
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 20], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 28], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 24], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 36], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 32], r4
        call sol_invoke       # Call ZKP verifier
        jeq r0, 1, error      # If verifier fails, error

    invoke_meme:
        # Call meme coin contract
        ldxdw [r10 + 24], r1  # Load program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Empty instruction_data
        call sol_invoke

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
version:
    .ascii "V1.0    "
bind_msg:
    .ascii "Bind matched    "
bind_table:
    # SOLFUNMEME: 🦠
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0
    .quad 0xSOLFUNMEME111
    .space 24
    # BONK: 🐶
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x90, 0xB6
    .quad 0xBONK111
    .space 24
    # PENGU: 🐧
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x90, 0xA7
    .quad 0xPENGU111
    .space 24
    # FARTCOIN: 💨
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x92, 0xA8
    .quad 0xFARTCOIN111
    .space 24
    # POPCAT: 😺
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x98, 0xBA
    .quad 0xPOPCAT111
    .space 24
zkp_program_id:

        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id

        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # r4 = accounts length
        mov64 r5, 1
        jne r4, r5, error

        # Load data account address
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r4    # r4 = data account pubkey (first 8 bytes)
        stx64 [r10 + 24], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4
        stx64 [r10 + 32], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r4
        stx64 [r10 + 40], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 32], r4
        stx64 [r10 + 48], r4

        # Read data account (40 bytes)
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 40
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Data length
        call sol_get_account_data  # Placeholder syscall to read account data

</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Emoji: 🦠 (0xF09FA6A0)
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 128
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Load data account (first account in r2)
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r3    # r3 = data account address
        mov64 r4, 40
        stxdw [r10 + 64], r4  # instruction_data length
        ldxb [r3 + 0], r4
        stxb [r10 + 72], r4   # TokenName
        ldxb [r3 + 8], r4
        stxb [r10 + 80], r4
        ldxb [r3 + 16], r4
        stxb [r10 + 88], r4   # TokenSymbol
        ldxdw [r3 + 24], r4
        stxdw [r10 + 96], r4  # HypeScore
        ldxb [r3 + 28], r4
        stxb [r10 + 100], r4  # ZOSStatus

        # Call base contract
        mov64 r1, base_program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        call sol_invoke

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
.data
base_program_id:
    .quad 0xBaseLogger111</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Binds two meme coin CAs, invokes both

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts (data account, CA1 data, CA2 data)
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Load cons data account (first account)
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r3    # r3 = cons data account
        mov64 r4, r10
        add64 r4, 64
        mov64 r5, 0
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r5    # Empty instruction_data

        # Invoke first CA
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r1    # r1 = CA1 program_id
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r5    # r5 = CA1 data account
        stx64 [r4 + 8], r5    # Pass CA1 data account
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Invoke second CA
        ldxdw [r3 + 32], r1   # r1 = CA2 program_id
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r5   # r5 = CA2 data account
        stx64 [r4 + 8], r5
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Log pair success
        mov64 r1, pair_msg
        call sol_log

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
pair_msg:
    .ascii "Pair invoked    "</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">Cons Data Account</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"> (64 bytes):</span></span></span></span><ul dir="ltr" style="display: block; Users send one emoji (e.g., </span><img alt="🦠" draggable="false" src="https://abs-0.twimg.com/emoji/v2/svg/1f9a0.svg" title="Microbe" class="r-4qtqp9 r-dflpy8 r-k4bwe5 r-1kpi4qh r-pp5qcn r-h9hxbl"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">) for a CA or two emojis (e.g., </span><img alt="🦠" draggable="false" src="https://abs-0.twimg.com/emoji/v2/svg/1f9a0.svg" title="Microbe" class="r-4qtqp9 r-dflpy8 r-k4bwe5 r-1kpi4qh r-pp5qcn r-h9hxbl"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">+</span><img alt="🐶" draggable="false" src="https://abs-0.twimg.com/emoji/v2/svg/1f436.svg" title="Dog face" class="r-4qtqp9 r-dflpy8 r-k4bwe5 r-1kpi4qh r-pp5qcn r-h9hxbl"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">) for a cons pair. It also supports ZKP proofs and imports a ZKP verifier.</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Linker Contract: EmojiMemeRouter
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3

        # Validate instruction_data (4 bytes for single, 8 for pair, +32 for ZKP)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 4
        mov64 r6, 8
        mov64 r7, 40          # 8 (pair) + 32 (ZKP)
        jlt r4, r5, error
        jgt r4, r7, error

        # Check for single emoji or pair
        jeq r4, r5, single_emoji
        jeq r4, r6, emoji_pair
        jeq r4, r7, emoji_pair_zkp

    single_emoji:
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # r4 = emoji
        mov64 r6, 0
        mov64 r7, 5
        mov64 r8, bind_table

    single_lookup:
        ge r6, r7, error
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, invoke_single
        add64 r8, 36
        add64 r6, 1
        ja single_lookup

    invoke_single:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # CA program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        call sol_invoke
        ja done

    emoji_pair:
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # r4 = first emoji
        ldxdw [r3 + 12], r5   # r5 = second emoji
        mov64 r6, 0
        mov64 r7, 5
        mov64 r8, bind_table

    pair_lookup1:
        ge r6, r7, error
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r9
        jeq r4, r9, pair_found1
        add64 r8, 36
        add64 r6, 1
        ja pair_lookup1

    pair_found1:
        stx64 [r10 + 64], r8  # Save first CA
        mov64 r6, 0</code></pre></div></div>

</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Logs emoji-fied SOLFUNMEME data
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3

        # Validate accounts (expect 2: EmojiPrint data, SOLFUNMEME data)
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error

        # Load EmojiPrint data (16 bytes)
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = EmojiPrint data account
        mov64 r4, r10
        add64 r4, 64
        ldxb [r3 + 0], r5
        stxb [r4 + 0], r5     # EmojiStyle (🦠🔥)

        # Load SOLFUNMEME data (TokenName, HypeScore)
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r3   # r3 = SOLFUNMEME data
        ldxb [r3 + 0], r5
        stxb [r4 + 8], r5     # TokenName
        ldxdw [r3 + 24], r5
        stxdw [r4 + 24], r5   # HypeScore

        # Log emoji-fied output
        mov64 r1, r4
        call sol_log          # Log "🦠 SOLFUNMEME: 950 🔥"

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data

</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Description: Binds EmojiPrint and SOLFUNMEME
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3

        # Validate accounts (expect 3: cons data, EmojiPrint data, SOLFUNMEME data)
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 3
        jne r4, r5, error

        # Load cons data (program IDs)
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = cons data account

        # Invoke EmojiPrint
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r1    # r1 = EmojiPrint program_id
        mov64 r4, r10
        add64 r4, 64
        mov64 r5, 2
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r5    # 2 accounts
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r5   # EmojiPrint data
        stxdw [r4 + 8], r5
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5   # SOLFUNMEME data
        stxdw [r4 + 16], r5
        call sol_invoke

        # Invoke SOLFUNMEME
        ldxdw [r3 + 32], r1   # r1 = SOLFUNMEME program_id
        mov64 r4, r10
        add64 r4, 64
        mov64 r5, 1
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r5    # 1 account
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5   # SOLFUNMEME data
        stxdw [r4 + 8], r5
        call sol_invoke

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
    .quad 0xEmojiPrint111
    .quad 0xSOLFUNMEME111</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Linker Contract: EmojiMemeRouter
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3

        # Validate instruction_data (4-byte emoji or 36-byte emoji+proof)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 4
        mov64 r6, 36
        jlt r4, r5, error
        jgt r4, r6, error

        # Load emoji
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4

        # Search bind table
        mov64 r6, 0
        mov64 r7, 1           # 1 pair
        mov64 r8, bind_table

    lookup_loop:
        ge r6, r7, error
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, found
        add64 r8, 36
        add64 r6, 1
        ja lookup_loop

    found:
        # ZKP proof (if 36 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 36
        jne r4, r5, invoke_cons
        mov64 r1, zkp_program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 32
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 12], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

    invoke_cons:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # Cons program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        call sol_invoke

        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
bind_table:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0  # 🦠
    .quad 0xConsPair111
    .space 24
zkp_program_id:
    .quad 0xZKPVerifier111</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom:         stxdw [r4 + 16], r5
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error
        ldxdw [r3 + 32], r1   # SOLFUNMEME program_id
        mov64 r4, r10
        add64 r4, 64
        mov64 r5, 1
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r5
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5
        stxdw [r4 + 8], r5
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error
        mov64 r1, pair_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
pair_msg:
    .ascii "Pair invoked    "</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Linker Contract: EmojiMemeRouter
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3

        # Validate instruction_data (4-byte emoji or 36-byte emoji+proof)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 4
        mov64 r6, 36
        jlt r4, r5, error
        jgt r4, r6, error

        # Load emoji (assume (eval (app emojiprint solfunmeme)) = 🦠)
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4

        # Search bind table
        mov64 r6, 0
        mov64 r7, 1
        mov64 r8, bind_table

    lookup_loop:
        ge r6, r7, error
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, found
        add64 r8, 36
        add64 r6, 1
        ja lookup_loop

    found:
        # ZKP proof (if 36 bytes)
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 36
        jne r4, r5, invoke_cons
        mov64 r1, zkp_program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 32
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 12], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

    invoke_cons:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # Cons program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Cons data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r4    # EmojiPrint data
        stxdw [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # SOLFUNMEME data
        stxdw [r3 + 24], r4
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r1, eval_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
bind_table:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0  # 🦠
    .quad 0xConsPair111
    .space 24
zkp_program_id:
    .quad 0xZKPVerifier111
eval_msg:
    .ascii "Eval (app emojiprint solfunmeme)"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; It focuses on the </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">linker contract</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"> to handle </span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-dyfej2 r-z2wwpe r-15gepa6 r-1471scf r-1aiqnjv r-1hq4qhi r-16dba41 r-ilng1c r-trst2h r-1noe1sz r-njp1lv"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">(eval (app emojiprint solfunmeme))</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">.</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Hex Bootloader
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Translates emoji-encoded program to eBPF

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256        # Allocate stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data

        # Validate accounts (expect 1: emoji data account)
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 1
        jne r4, r5, error

        # Load emoji data account
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = data account
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = byte offset
        mov64 r7, 1024        # r7 = max bytes (arbitrary limit)

    parse_loop:
        ge r6, r7, done       # Exit if offset &gt;= max
        ldxdw [r3 + r6], r4   # r4 = 4-byte emoji

        # Map emoji to instruction
        mov64 r8, emoji_map   # r8 = emoji-to-opcode table
        mov64 r9, 0           # r9 = map index
        mov64 r1, 8           # 8 entries in map

    map_loop:
        ge r9, r1, try_data   # If no instruction match, try data
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5    # r5 = emoji from table
        jeq r4, r5, map_found
        add64 r8, 8           # Next entry (4-byte emoji, 4-byte opcode)
        add64 r9, 1
        ja map_loop

    map_found:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = opcode
        call sol_log_64       # Log translated opcode
        add64 r6, 4           # Next emoji
        ja parse_loop

    try_data:
        # Handle data (e.g., 📜S, 🦠, 🔢950)
        mov64 r8, data_map
        mov64 r9, 0
        mov64 r1, 3           # 3 data types (ASCII, emoji, number)

    data_loop:
        ge r9, r1, skip_data
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, data_found
        add64 r8, 8
        add64 r9, 1
        ja data_loop

    data_found:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = data type handler
        call r1               # Call handler (placeholder)
        add64 r6, 4
        ja parse_loop

    skip_data:
        add64 r6, 4
        ja parse_loop

    done:
        mov64 r1, boot_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
boot_msg:
    .ascii "Bootloader done "
emoji_map:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x9B, 0xA0  # 🛠️
    .byte 0xBF, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # mov64
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9E, 0x95, 0x00  # ➕
    .byte 0x0F, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # add64
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9E, 0x96, 0x00  # ➖
    .byte 0x1F, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # sub64
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0xA5  # 📥
    .byte 0x61, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # ldxdw
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0xA4  # 📤
    .byte 0x71, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # stxdw
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0x9E  # 📞
    .byte 0x85, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # call
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9D, 0x93, 0x00  # ❓
    .byte 0x15, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # jeq
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x9A, 0x8A  # 🚪
    .byte 0x95, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # exit
data_map:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0x9C  # 📜 (ASCII prefix)
    .byte 0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # ASCII handler
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0  # 🦠
    .byte 0x02, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # Emoji handler
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x94, 0xA2  # 🔢

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 64
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        mov64 r1, opcode
        call sol_log_64       # Log 0xBF
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Hex Bootloader CA
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # 2 accounts: emoji data, env data
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = emoji data
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = env data
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = offset
        mov64 r7, 1024        # r7 = max bytes

    parse_loop:
        ge r6, r7, done
        ldxdw [r3 + r6], r8   # r8 = emoji (4 bytes)
        mov64 r9, r4          # r9 = env base
        mov64 r1, 10          # 10 env entries

    env_lookup:
        ldxdw [r9 + 0], r2    # r2 = env emoji
        jeq r8, r2, invoke_ca
        add64 r9, 36
        add64 r1, -1
        jgt r1, 0, env_lookup
        ja skip_emoji

    invoke_ca:
        ldxdw [r9 + 4], r1    # r1 = CA program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r2, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r2    # Empty instruction_data
        call sol_invoke       # Invoke CA (logs opcode/data)

    skip_emoji:
        add64 r6, 4
        ja parse_loop

    done:
        mov64 r1, boot_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Linker Contract
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 4
        mov64 r6, 36
        jlt r4, r5, error
        jgt r4, r6, error
        ldxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # r4 = 🦠
        mov64 r8, bind_table
        ldxdw [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, found
        ja error

    found:
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 36
        jne r4, r5, invoke_cons
        mov64 r1, zkp_program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 32
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r3 + 12], r4
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

    invoke_cons:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # Cons CA
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Cons data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r4    # EmojiPrint data
        stxdw [r3 + 16], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # SOLFUNMEME data
        stxdw [r3 + 24], r4
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r1, eval_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
bind_table:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0  # 🦠
    .quad 0xConsPair111
    .space 24
zkp_program_id:
    .quad 0xZKPVerifier111
eval_msg:
    .ascii "Eval (app emojiprint solfunmeme)"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: It’s a CA (</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-dyfej2 r-z2wwpe r-15gepa6 r-1471scf r-1aiqnjv r-1hq4qhi r-16dba41 r-ilng1c r-trst2h r-1noe1sz r-njp1lv"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">EmojiDump111...</span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">) that reverses the hex bootloader’s logic.</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Emoji Dump Util CA
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Dumps bytecode/data as emojis

.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256        # Allocate stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 1 account: program/data
        mov64 r5, 1
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = input account
        mov64 r6, 0           # r6 = offset
        mov64 r7, 1024        # r7 = max bytes

    dump_loop:
        ge r6, r7, done
        ldxb [r3 + r6], r4    # r4 = byte (opcode or data)
        mov64 r8, opcode_map  # r8 = opcode-to-emoji table
        mov64 r9, 0
        mov64 r1, 8           # 8 opcodes

    opcode_loop:
        ge r9, r1, try_data
        ldxb [r8 + 0], r5     # r5 = opcode
        jeq r4, r5, opcode_found
        add64 r8, 12          # 4-byte opcode, 8-byte emoji
        add64 r9, 1
        ja opcode_loop

    opcode_found:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = emoji (first 8 bytes)
        call sol_log          # Log emoji (e.g., 🛠️)
        add64 r6, 1
        ja dump_loop

    try_data:
        mov64 r8, data_map
        mov64 r9, 0
        mov64 r1, 2           # 2 data types (ASCII, number)

    data_loop:
        ge r9, r1, skip_data
        ldxb [r8 + 0], r5
        jeq r4, r5, data_found
        add64 r8, 12
        add64 r9, 1
        ja data_loop

    data_found:
        ldxdw [r8 + 4], r1    # r1 = emoji or handler
        call sol_log
        add64 r6, 1
        ja dump_loop

    skip_data:
        mov64 r1, r4          # Log raw byte as fallback
        call sol_log_64
        add64 r6, 1
        ja dump_loop

    done:
        mov64 r1, dump_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit
.data
dump_msg:
    .ascii "Emoji dump done "
opcode_map:
    .byte 0xBF
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x9B, 0xA0, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 🛠️
    .byte 0x0F
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9E, 0x95, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # ➕
    .byte 0x1F
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9E, 0x96, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # ➖
    .byte 0x61
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0xA5, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 📥
    .byte 0x71
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0xA4, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 📤
    .byte 0x85
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0x9E, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 📞
    .byte 0x15
    .byte 0xE2, 0x9D, 0x93, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # ❓
    .byte 0x95
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x9A, 0xAA, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 🚪
data_map:
    .byte 0x53  # S (example for SOLFUNMEME)
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x93, 0x9C, 0x53, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 📜S
    .byte 0x00  # Placeholder for numbers
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0x94, 0xA2, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00  # 🔢</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-b88u0q r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">How It Works</span></span></span></span><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">:</span></span></span></span><ul dir="ltr" style="display: block; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Emoji-AS CA
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        sub64 r10, 256
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # 2 accounts: emoji source, env
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = emoji source
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = env
        mov64 r6, 0
        mov64 r7, 1024

    assemble_loop:
        ge r6, r7, done
        ldxdw [r3 + r6], r8   # r8 = emoji
        mov64 r9, r4
        mov64 r1, 10          # 10 env entries

    env_lookup:
        ldxdw [r9 + 0], r2
        jeq r8, r2, invoke_ca
        add64 r9, 36
        add64 r1, -1
        jgt r1, 0, env_lookup
        ja skip_emoji

    invoke_ca:
        ldxdw [r9 + 4], r1    # r1 = declaration CA
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 64
        mov64 r2, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r2
        call sol_invoke       # Get opcode/data
        add64 r6, 4
        ja assemble_loop

    skip_emoji:
        add64 r6, 4
        ja assemble_loop

    done:
        mov64 r1, as_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit
    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

</span>Translates emoji-encoded programs to sBPF bytecode, bootstrapping the SOLFUNMEME vibe!

```emoji
➖📚🔢256             🖼️ Allocate 256 bytes on stack
📤[📚+0]🅰️           🖼️ Save program_id
📤[📚+8]📍           🖼️ Save accounts
📤[📚+16]📜          🖼️ Save instruction_data
📥[📍+0]🅱️          🖼️ Check accounts (expect 2: emoji data, env)
🛠️🅲🔢2             🖼️ mov64 r5, 2
❓🅱️≠🅲🚫error      🖼️ jne r4, r5, error
📥[📍+8]🅼          🖼️ r3 = emoji data account
📥[📍+16]🅽         🖼️ r4 = env data account
🛠️🅾️🔢0            🖼️ r6 = offset
🛠️🅿️🔢1024         🖼️ r7 = max bytes
📥[🅼+🅾️]🆀         🖼️ r8 = emoji
🛠️🆁📜emoji_map     🖼️ r8 = emoji-to-opcode table
🛠️🆂🔢0            🖼️ r9 = map index
🛠️🅰️🔢8           🖼️ r1 = 8 entries
📥[🆁+0]🅽         🖼️ r5 = table emoji
❓🆀=🅽🚫map_found  🖼️ jeq r8, r5, map_found
➕🆁🔢8            🖼️ Next entry
➕🆂🔢1            🖼️ Increment index
📞🗣️              🖼️ Log opcode
📜Bootloader done  🖼️ Final log
🚪                 🖼️ Exit</code></pre></div></div><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span>

# Emoji Dump Util 🌟
Dumps bytecode/data as emojis, like objdump for the SOLFUNMEME vibe!

```emoji
➖📚🔢256             🖼️ Allocate stack
📤[📚+0]🅰️           🖼️ Save program_id
📥[📍+0]🅱️          🖼️ Expect 1 account
🛠️🅲🔢1             🖼️ mov64 r5, 1
❓🅱️≠🅲🚫error      🖼️ jne r4, r5, error
📥[📍+8]🅼          🖼️ r3 = input account
🛠️🅾️🔢0            🖼️ r6 = offset
🛠️🅿️🔢1024         🖼️ r7 = max bytes
📥[🅼+🅾️]🅱️         🖼️ r4 = byte
🛠️🆁📜opcode_map    🖼️ r8 = opcode-to-emoji table
📥[🆁+0]🅽         🖼️ r5 = opcode
❓🅱️=🅽🚫opcode_found 🖼️ jeq r4, r5, opcode_found
📞🗣️              🖼️ Log emoji (e.g., 🛠️)
📜Emoji dump done  🖼️ Final log
🚪                 🖼️ Exit</code></pre></div></div><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span>

# Cons Contract 🤝
Binds EmojiPrint and SOLFUNMEME, invokes both for the pair!

```emoji
➖📚🔢256             🖼️ Allocate stack
📤[📚+0]🅰️           🖼️ Save program_id
📥[📍+0]🅱️          🖼️ Expect 3 accounts
🛠️🅲🔢3             🖼️ mov64 r5, 3
❓🅱️≠🅲🚫error      🖼️ jne r4, r5, error
📥[📍+8]🅼          🖼️ r3 = cons data

</span>### Step 2: Environment (Unchanged)
The **env** (`EnvData111...`) maps emojis to CAs:
- 🛠️ → `Mov64CA111...`
- 📜S → `SDataCA111...`
- 🦠 → `ConsPair111...`

### Step 3: Hex Bootloader (Unchanged)
Reads emoji-encoded Markdown from a data account, invokes declaration CAs via the env, and reconstructs sBPF bytecode.

### Step 4: Livestream Integration
- **User Input**: X-streamers send 🦠 via wallet/UI to trigger `(eval (app emojiprint solfunmeme))`.
- **Display**: Pipe Markdown files to VLC using a Node.js script (parse `.md`, render emojis), showing 🛠️➖📜 alongside logs (“🦠 SOLFUNMEME: 950 🔥”).
- **ZKP Badges**: Show “✅ Verified” for proofs.
- **Memory Fix**: If VLC lags, use OBS at 800kbps or close apps.

</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Translates 🦠 to cons CA invoke

.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 64         # Tiny stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 2 accounts: emoji data, cons data
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = emoji data
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # r4 = emoji (🦠)
        mov64 r5, emoji_solfun
        jeq r4, r5, invoke
        ja error

    invoke:
        mov64 r1, cons_ca     # Cons CA program_id
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Empty instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # Cons data account
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r1, boot_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emoji_solfun:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0  # 🦠
cons_ca:
    .quad 0xConsPair111
boot_msg:
    .ascii "Boot done"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 For simplicity, we’ll assume the LLM response is a pre-stored emoji sequence in a data account (real LLM integration would use an off-chain API).</span></span></span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-1adg3ll r-ag158w r-dnmrzs r-1yx7oqi r-13qz1uu"><div class="css-175oi2r r-dnmrzs r-1adg3ll r-13qz1uu" data-testid="markdown-code-block"><div class="css-175oi2r r-1awozwy r-1fkb3t2 r-1fs5b29 r-1idry7j r-6413gk r-43g30s r-l4nmg1 r-1u658rm r-2dysd3 r-vmopo1 r-13qz1uu r-gtdqiz r-1fhadnw r-184en5c"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-1aiqnjv r-n6v787"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">asm</span></span><div class="css-175oi2r r-xoduu5 r-1ybcz0z"></div></div><pre style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.3; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none; padding: 12px; margin: 0px 0px 0.5em; overflow: auto; background: rgb(22, 24, 28); display: block; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 8px; border-bottom-right-radius: 8px;"><code class="language-text" style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212); font-size: 13px; text-shadow: none; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, &quot;Andale Mono&quot;, &quot;Ubuntu Mono&quot;, &quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; direction: ltr; text-align: left; white-space: pre; word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Reflect Contract
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Calls CA, sends data to LLM, feeds response to emoji interpreter

.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 128        # Small stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 3 accounts: target CA data, LLM response, cons data
        mov64 r5, 3
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = target CA data (EmojiPrint data)
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = LLM response (emoji code)
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5   # r5 = cons data

        # Call target CA (EmojiPrint)
        mov64 r1, emojiprint_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Empty instruction_data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r3    # Pass EmojiPrint data
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Simulate LLM API call (log output, load response)
        mov64 r1, reflect_msg
        call sol_log          # Log "Reflect to LLM"
        ldxdw [r4 + 0], r6    # r6 = emoji response (e.g., 🛠️📞)
        mov64 r1, r6
        call sol_log          # Log LLM response

        # Call emoji interpreter (hex bootloader)
        mov64 r1, bootloader_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # Empty instruction_data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4    # Pass LLM response
        stxdw [r3 + 16], r5   # Pass cons data
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        mov64 r1, done_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emojiprint_ca:
    .quad 0xEmojiPrint111
bootloader_ca:
    .quad 0xBootloaderCA111
reflect_msg:
    .ascii "Reflect to LLM"
done_msg:
    .ascii "Reflect done"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 word-spacing: normal; word-break: normal; line-height: 1.5; tab-size: 4; hyphens: none;"><span># Smallest Emoji Bootloader
</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 64
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = emoji data
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r4    # r4 = emoji (🦠)
        mov64 r5, emoji_solfun
        jeq r4, r5, invoke
        ja error

    invoke:
        mov64 r1, cons_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r4, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r4
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # Cons data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r4
        call sol_invoke
        mov64 r1, boot_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emoji_solfun:
    .byte 0xF0, 0x9F, 0xA6, 0xA0
cons_ca:
    .quad 0xConsPair111
boot_msg:
    .ascii "Boot done"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-adyw6z r-135wba7 r-b88u0q" style="display: block; margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Monitors EmojiPrint logs in real-time, stores to data account

.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 128        # Small stack
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 2 accounts: target CA data, output data
        mov64 r5, 2
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = EmojiPrint data
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = output data account

        # Call EmojiPrint to capture logs
        mov64 r1, emojiprint_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r5, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r5    # Empty instruction_data
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r3    # Pass EmojiPrint data
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Store captured log to output data account
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r5    # r5 = logged data (e.g., 🦠 SOLFUNMEME: 950 🔥)
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r5    # Store to output account
        mov64 r1, r5
        call sol_log          # Log captured data

        # Log monitoring status
        mov64 r1, monitor_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emojiprint_ca:
    .quad 0xEmojiPrint111
monitor_msg:
    .ascii "Monitor captured"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 </span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Monitors CA logs, updates matrix of floats

.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 256        # Stack for matrix ops
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 3 accounts: target CA data, model data, output data
        mov64 r5, 3
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = EmojiPrint data
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = model data
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5   # r5 = output data

        # Call target CA (EmojiPrint)
        mov64 r1, emojiprint_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r6, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r6
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r3    # Pass EmojiPrint data
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Capture log and update matrix
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r6    # r6 = log data (e.g., 🦠 SOLFUNMEME: 950 🔥)
        stxdw [r5 + 0], r6    # Store log to output data
        ldxdw [r4 + 0], r7    # r7 = matrix[0][0] (e.g., log_count)
        mov64 r8, 0x3F800000  # r8 = 1.0 (float32)
        add64 r7, r8          # Increment log_count
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r7    # Update matrix
        mov64 r1, r6
        call sol_log          # Log captured data

        # Log matrix update
        mov64 r1, monitor_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emojiprint_ca:
    .quad 0xEmojiPrint111

</span># Solana sBPF Assembly
# Author: GROK3@solfunmeme.com
# Date: 03-Aug-2025
# Description: Monitors EmojiPrint, updates matrix with vernacular emojis

.text
    entrypoint:
        mov64 r10, 256        # Stack for matrix ops
        stx64 [r10 + 0], r1   # Save program_id
        stx64 [r10 + 8], r2   # Save accounts
        stx64 [r10 + 16], r3  # Save instruction_data
        ldxdw [r2 + 0], r4    # Expect 3 accounts: EmojiPrint data, model data, output data
        mov64 r5, 3
        jne r4, r5, error
        ldxdw [r2 + 8], r3    # r3 = EmojiPrint data
        ldxdw [r2 + 16], r4   # r4 = model data
        ldxdw [r2 + 24], r5   # r5 = output data

        # Call EmojiPrint
        mov64 r1, emojiprint_ca
        mov64 r3, r10
        add64 r3, 32
        mov64 r6, 0
        stxdw [r3 + 0], r6
        stxdw [r3 + 8], r3
        call sol_invoke
        jeq r0, 1, error

        # Capture and log with vernacular
        ldxdw [r3 + 0], r6    # r6 = log (🦠 SOLFUNMEME: 950 🔥)
        stxdw [r5 + 0], r6    # Store to output data
        mov64 r1, r6
        call sol_log          # Log 🦠📊

        # Update matrix
        ldxdw [r4 + 0], r7    # r7 = matrix[0][0] (log_count)
        mov64 r8, 0x3F800000  # r8 = 1.0 (float32)
        add64 r7, r8
        stxdw [r4 + 0], r7    # Update matrix
        mov64 r1, matrix_msg
        call sol_log          # Log 📊🧠Matrix updated

    done:
        mov64 r1, done_msg
        call sol_log
        mov64 r0, 0
        exit

    error:
        mov64 r0, 1
        exit

.data
emojiprint_ca:
    .quad 0xEmojiPrint111
matrix_msg:
    .ascii "📊🧠Matrix updated"
done_msg:
    .ascii "📊Monitor done"</code></pre></div></div><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3 r-1adg3ll r-1g7jtus r-1x3r274"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0
